description: Smallest term in any sequence of n consecutive Smith numbers (A006753).
references: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, Section B49.
Samuel Yates, Smith Numbers Congruent to 4 (Mod 9), Journal of Recreational Mathematics, Vol. 19(2), 1987.
example: The third number is 73615 since 73615, 73616, 73617 is the first example of 3 consecutive Smith numbers.
author: _Shyam Sunder Gupta_, Feb 11 2001
extensions: a(7) from Jens Kruse Andersen. _Max Alekseyev_, Apr 21 2010
